Name: Sphinx
Description: This sphinx of sandstone comes from the belgian excavations of Elkab. It is characterised by a human head, more specifically, a royal head wearing the "nemes" head-dress and a false beard. The sphinx, which was originally a solar symbol, protector of the horizon, became from the New Kingdom onwards a protector of temples. Thus they are to be seen in rows guarding sanctuary entrances. This example of Brussels probably dates from the Late Period.
